input_text.Prompt: Can you tell me how to serve at a dinner party?
input_text.Response A:
Place easy, general dishes on the table for guests to help themselves to.
Put complicated, delicate and artistic food on the plates in the kitchen.
Decide on your serving order.
Pass all dishes from the left.
Keep the courses rolling.
Amaze guests with your knowledge.
Clear only two plates at a time, from the right.
Clean plates out of sight.
Remove main course dishes before bringing out dessert.
Serve cream, dessert toppings and sugar from the left.
As the cook, or host, always serve yourself last.
Don't be afraid to ask for help.
input_text.Response B:
Serving at a dinner party can be a bit overwhelming but with some planning and organization, it can be a breeze. Here are a few tips:
1. Plan the menu ahead of time and prepare as much as possible in advance.
2. Set the table ahead of time and have everything you need on hand.
3. Serve the salad and appetizers before the main course.
4. Serve the main course and sides all at once.
5. Let your guests help themselves to drinks and coffee.
6. Make sure to have extra napkins, utensils, and glasses on hand.
7. Enjoy the company and don't worry if everything isn't perfect. Your guests will appreciate the effort you put into the evening!

label_annotations.feedback: Preferred the way that response B wrote, but chatbot A answered the question more fully (although there was a lot of extra rubbish in the answer!)
